channel.title: The Morning After STL
channel.description: The Morning After STL is the longest-running local sports morning show in St. Louis. Tim McKernan, Martin Kilcoyne, Doug Vaughn, and Jackson Burkett have the fortune of hosting the circus each morning from 7 a.m. to 11 a.m. -- LIVE on 101 ESPN Radio at 101.1 FM, https://101ESPN.com, https://TMASTL.com, TMASTL YouTube, The TMASTL app, and anywhere you find podcasts.

item.title: TMA-Segment 3: Doug's all Cauc team, meaty baseball talk, EOTD
item.description:

item.title: TMA (10-28-24) Hour 1
item.description:
• Hey look, everyone, it's Martin Kilcoyne and we're on 101 ESPN now. Bittersweet this morning. There's not another personality around like Iggy Strode. Iggy's rolodex. Jackson has a dossier ready to go.
  • One segment down and Martin is thinking about quitting. Joey Vitale is up and listening and his nips are hard. The formula for creating a TMA text name. Tough one for Mizzou on Saturday, especially after Brady Cook went down. Drew Pyne may not be the guy. The Tigers laid two eggs against their two biggest opponents. Big miss to not have a backup QB. Luther Burden had 3 catches for 3 yards. Lots of talent back from last season but it just hasn't translated. Our niche is homoerotic sports radio.
  • Chariman Kurt "met" the love of his life in Tuscaloosa. Met might be the wrong word as he didn't exactly talk to her. She just had an aura about her. Would she have been willing to date an older fella? The Hinge and Bumble scene down in Alabama. Hard to bring a girl back to the Red Roof Inn with your dad in the same room. The needlepoint belts were all over the place. Doug is officiating the Plowhawk's wedding.
  • Martin has prepared a poem for us. Jackson may or may not have given out the wrong phone number. Not sure who is going to filter the phone calls during this moment of transition. Martin meets Libby Jack.

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: TMA (10-28-24) Hour 2
item.description:
• The YouTube chat is active this morning. Martin reads some mean tweets about the show changes from over the weekend. We welcome your hatred. Everything goes back to, "It should be good for Timmy."
  • Our first guest on 101, Chris Kerber, joins us to talk about the Blues' weekend. Chief coming back to St. Louis. Some breaking news coming up on the Tuscaloosa girl in the Tiger striped dress. Does Buck Swope have a real job?
  • A listener has DM'd a picture of what could be the tiger-striped dress girl. Unfortunately it is not her, but it is Brady Cook's mom. Audio of Drink following the loss in Tuscaloosa. Drink's post-game presser was short and sweet on Saturday.
  • Audio of Freddie Freeman's historic game-winning grand slam on Friday night. Hell of a call from joe Davis. Audio of Aaron Boone explaining the logic of using Nestor Cortes. Dodgers up 2-0 going into Game 3 tonight in The Bronx. The BYU coach went to Kirkwood High.

item.description:
• Missouri is where I live. Gabe DeArmond joins us to talk about the disaster in Tuscaloosa. How long will Brady Cook be out with his hand injury? Hope is that it is not season-ending, but the Oklahoma game could be in jeopardy. Hopes of the College Football Playoffs are dead. Will players be opting out with less to play for now? Looking back on the many TMA stops throughout the 20 years. The 590 The Man/1380 The Woman situation. The Late Night Score & Nick and The Badger.
  • Quite an ending in the Commanders Bears game yesterday. Bone-headed play by the Bears defender. Audio of Mike Francesa and he's not happy with the Jets and their interim coach. Some of our old texters have found their way to the new text line. Doug's fescue situation. Martin's gotta go at 10.
  • Warfare going on in the two YouTube chats. Hate listeners. Guest hosts when some of the regulars are out. BenFred's article about Nolan Arenado. Will he be back next season? Moves that weren't made in the last couple years.

item.title: TMA (10-28-24) Hour 4
item.description:
• Balloon Party is now Hour 4 of TMA. Just know, Jackson is happy. Jackson's got some questions for us. How the 12-Team Playoff will affect expectations within college football programs. Anarchy is on the horizon. Missouri and Illinois hopes are gone but lots of excitement down the stretch in the CFB world. Should Jackson and Tim forget their salaries in exchange for longer segments. Chairman still reeling from missing out on the love of his life. Will Mizzou score again this season if Drew Pyne is the QB?
  • Mike Elko firing some shots in his postgame comments on Saturday. Who was he talking about? Tim's tongue. Big game Saturday in the Big Ten between Ohio State and Penn State. Outstanding College Gameday in Bloomington. Kirk Hebstreit and Lee Corso.
  • Doug is getting acclimated to the 10:00 hour. The debut of the Email of the Day segment on 101 coming up. Tim found himself pulling for the Cleveland Browns yesterday. Audio of Jameis Winston channeling his inner Marshall Mathers after the Browns win. Supercut of Gabe's voicemails from the Power Mizzou post-game show. Jackson's not a fan of Harrison's Brother, Master. Jackson's JUICY shorts. Follow us on IG at tma_stl.
  • E-Mail of the Day

item.title: TMA (10-29-24) Hour 1
item.description:
• This Burke guy is kind of a mutt. What's Jackson's hockey nickname? If you can see us as you drive down Olive, give us a wave. Jackson's magic dossier. Martin said down with John Mozeliak for the 2Fox. Piddles is a poor speller. The Whale Tail Phenomenon. WHY IS CHAIM BLOOM HIDING?!?! Pale Whales. Props to Tommy for reducing the commercial breaks. Figuring out the phone liens in this time of transition.
  • John Kelly joining us at 8:15. Yankees might be in some trouble. Should Aaron Boone sit Aaron Boone? The LaRussa/Rolen beef. Fun with percentages. Ludacris at The Dome. Fat Joe at Yankee Stadium. Fat Joe can't walk. Cardinals had Rascal Flats perform and ProdJoe proclaimed that the Cardinals would never win another World Series. Audio of Fat Joe's performance. VIP Pat is our first caller. Banty on The Fan Page yesterday.
  • Listeners are streaming while sky-pigging. YouTube chat talking about Mt. Rushmore of fat rappers. Audio of John Sterling getting fooled by a fly ball. Martin sat down with Martin Kilcoyne yesterday. Audio of Mo talking about the rumor of the Cardinals being sold. Is there a succession plan in place for the DeWitts? Bad time to sell. The structure of the Cardinals' front office.

item.title: TMA (10-29-24) Hour 2
item.description:
• A little clock abuse so we're gonna get back on track. Who is your "Pale Whale"? Doug thinks Mike Shildt. John Mozeliak gave Shildt the green light to talk about the firing but we've never heard his side.
  • Blues play-by-play guy John Kelly joins us on the phone lines from Ottawa. What positives and negatives has he seen in the Blues early on? Injuries has been a problem. Team speed seems to be improved. Reuniting with Craig Berube.
  • Jackson's random NBA SportsCenter update. Taking calls at the 2Fox asking for scores. Should we get Fernando Vina to call in? Caller Adam has found his way to the 101 phone lines. Adam is angry about no one answering the phones. Globule of lube. Coconut oil at room temperature. Tom Schmitt knows good lube and BBQ. Adam has been potted down. Would Kevin Demoff talk and would you want to talk to him? Speculation of Demoff being a possible NFL commissioner.
  • Martin wasn't happy with Adam's call. The conspiracy theory around drafting Michael Sam. Tim had Jeff Fisher on his podcast. Doug's Fisher impression is all jowl. Texts coming in on Pale Whale suggestions. Mike Keenan and Frank Cusumano didn't get along real well. Calvin May & The Skipper.

item.title: TMA (10-29-24) Hour 3
item.description:
• Andy Crouppen and his luscious head of hair join us in-studio talking about perjury. How could we get Kroenke and Demoff to tell the truth? Rams trying to buy the spot in Earth City for $1.
  • Jackson's got "So What'd Your Grandma Think" for us. Jackson needs the drapes drawn. Giving Martin the context with audio of Calvin May asking Jason Heyward what his grandma thought. A reporter questioned Trevon Diggs' effort and Diggs went lookin' for him. Things got a little tense. Audio of Shannon Sharpe defending the reporter on his podcast with Ochocinco. Ochocinco is Jackson's Pale Whale.
  • Martin was pleased with Jackson's NBA update. Audio of Mozeliak talking with Martin about the fans supporting the Cardinals going forward through some tough times. Cards use of technology. The Minor League pipeline. The Cardinals were wondering in 2014 what they had in Oscar Tavares. The difficulty identifying talent goes back a decade. The Cards' model going forward.
  • Liaa has a question on the phone lines. Lisa's not happy with Oli's leadership and Doug's not happy with Lisa's language. Strange timing of the Marmol extension. Managers vs. Analytics. Martin very briefly goes into Tony.

See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: TMA (10-29-24) Hour 4
item.description:
• Doug's concerned we may have to start going to Blues morning skate. Checking in on the text line. Jackson is really battling the sun in this studio. Doug's Jackie O sunglasses. Doug's had enough and he's gonna fix the drapes situation. Jackson's all about the giggles. And in a surprising hot take, Jackson seems down on the premise of Back To The Future. Is Martin cruising around Creve Coeur Park?
  • Questions 'O' Plenty with Lil Piddles. Fandom in cold weather vs. warm weather cities. Would Jackson rather go to the Blues vs. Leafs or stay home and play video games? Local athletes with wide deltas of fan approval. Matheny was beloved as a player but not so much as manager. Warner & Bulger.
  • We somehow missed the 13 year anniversary of the David Freese game. Thanks to the listener in the text inbox for letting us know. But that means the Cardinals won the World Series 13 years ago today. Yankees on life support. Uniform nirvana. Human lamb.

item.title: TMA (10-30-24) Hour 1
item.description:
• Martin ran into Misty Plops and he seemed totally normal. We really wanna test out the phone line system today. Someone called in that saw Martin in Maui. And Caller Buzz makes his 101 ESPN debut. Martin would like to know if he has to go to trivia night. There's some hate coming in the text line but we're going through a reset. Blues had a small issue last night in Ottawa.
  • Tim had a nice conversation with a listener yesterday. Tough one last night in Ottawa. Blues lose 8-1. Audio of a disappointed Drew Bannister after last night's drubbing. You can't chase the game, Tim. Big Walt had to have been happy last night. Encouraging start to the road trip but not as much now. TMA After Dark. Bringing the cuckold and sports communities together. Clock changing soon, quite soon. Jackson wasn't allowed to say, "I don't know."
  • HUGE win yesterday in EMOTD by Misty Plops. Is Plops a nesting body now? We have a Game 5 in the World Series as the Yankee stave off elimination. Audio of the fans trying to pry the ball from Mookie Betts last night. The brothers aren't welcome back at Yankee Stadium. Are these guys the Yankees Rally Squirrel? Jack Flaherty on the mound tonight for the Dodgers. Reliving the Flaherty/Derrick Goold exchange. When the Hoosier Father/Son tandem attacked the coach in Chicago. Too much Bama runnin' through my veins.
  • Jackson's opening up the doors to the Fan Page today. Power outage in Ottawa last night and they sure turned the lights out on the Blues. The journey of the Blues trunk. Evanesence stole it but left it in Ottawa.

item.title: TMA (10-30-24) Hour 2
item.description:
• We're joined by the man who coined the nickname "Lil Piddles," Jamie Rivers. Jamie has an issue with the show already. Rivers is friends with some members of Evanesence and he wasn't happy with Piddle's song choice. What to make of that game last night. Growing pains with some of these younger players. Is this a playoff team? The Note in Philadelphia before returning home to face Chief. Dental cuckings.
  • Would Jackson rather watch the Blues or answer the phone lines? We may all get together to watch the game. Team transportation doesn't wait for media. Frank Cusumano steals luggage. Is Jackson too elite to answer the phones? A symphony of Frank drops.
  • Calling into sports talk radio. Audio from Martin's conversation with John Mozeliak. The path that lead to where the Cardinals are currently. Roleplaying with Tim as the reporter and Martin as Mo. Mo's answers are rather unsatisfying.
  • Reading rapid fire texts from the text line. Reminiscing the days of randomly calling sorority houses on The Morning Grind. Francesa and Stan Lee.

item.title: TMA (10-30-24) Hour 3
item.description:
• Jeremy Rutherford joins us for two-part questions following the drubbing in Ottawa last night. Where are the home white sweaters? Country Roads. Adults wearing jerseys. Does Drew Bannister have a presence as coach? Corduroy. Which Blues have sand paper to their game? This year's expectations.
  • Texters coming after Martin. Those pesky brothers at Yankee Stadium trying to take Mookie Betts glove. The boys were ready to D Up. The Yankees haven't responded to ESPN's request for comment. If the Yankees come back will they be on the ring?
  • The ESPN voiceover guy had some issues with Jackson's last name. Great job if you can get it. Mr. Lix is down on Charlotte. Filling Martin in on Jackson's boys trip to the mountains. IT's starting to happen, we're starting to win em over. Bobby Magic and The Human Ashtray. Catching Martin up on what he's missed the last 18 years. Going dutch on a bed. The Professor.
  • More fun with voiceover miscues. Dough Vaughn. Ooooh, the 618 is a lady. Nevermind, they don't like us.

item.description:

  • Buck Swope has texted Tim to correct the EMOTD standings. Audio of Desmond Howard talking college football with some strange sound effects in it. Ferrario's ball gag. Jackson's golf swing. He's a little champion. Courier Tom is on the phone lines and he wants to know if Luther Burden is ready for the pros. Burden's draft stock.
  • Wide Berth Wednesday. Lot of statue talk going around with the Dwayne Wade statue situation. Which St. Louis athletes are statue worthy? Is Pietrangelo worthy of a statue? A Kyle Lohse Skip Schumaker statue would look good. Doug missed the Freese homerun in 2011 for a live shot.

item.title: TMA (10-31-24) Hour 1
item.description:
• (Apologies for the first few seconds. Hardware issue.) Doug is dressed like a little conductor today. Sirens going off around 2:45 this morning. The TMA Glossary: The Webster Groves vs. Cottleville War. Tim's keys are going off. Janet is a rising star. Bobcat Nostalgia. It's Listener of the Month SZN. Joe Strauss coined "Pee Pee Talk." Amendment 2. How do the teams benefit? Martin's got a surprise guest at 9:30. Jackson wanted to take in Reteif Goosen.
  • Two horse race in the October EMOTD contest. Audio of the final out of Dodgers World Series win. Yankees really let one slip away last night. Judge's drop in centerfield reminiscent of Matt Holliday. Gerrit Cole forgot to cover first base. Paul from the wealthy part of West County calls in to pitch a TMA Halloween party. The texters aren't real pleased with it.
  • Polling data on Amendment 2. Why is Martin so against this amendment? Is it morality and religious beliefs working against it? Doug's not much of a gambler. TikTok is not just moms dancing and looking for attention. Get your FYP right.
  • Martin's getting texts from Cousin John. Some are concerned about the effect on minors. Does our audience skew more liberal or conservative? Jackson doesn't wear a lot of khaki. We make picks.....YOU MAKE MONEY! Martin's read on Jack Flaherty was spot on.

Mike was hanging out at Barstool watching the game. Doug's not convinced that 'dossier' is being used correctly. Reuben Studdard.
  • Blues Hall of Famer, Bernie Federko joins us. What type of response does he expect to see after what happened in Ottawa? Shaking up lines. What kind of reception does he expect when Craig Berube returns? The Hubbard President seemed a little confused with Doug's conductor hat. Polar Express. Joe Davis & Vin Scully.
  • Audio of Joe Davis talking about his World Series calls. Announcers preparing calls for big moments. Jack Buck thought he blew the Go Crazy Folks call. Eric in the CWE is on the phone lines. Trying to alienate 101 ESPN and TMA listeners. Just a couple guys flirting with each other.
  • Someone's not happy with Jackson and Eric in the CWE flirting. Martin questions the dossier. Cards Nation 95 is on the line and he's not happy with us. Talking burgers and fries. He's trying to give us a chance.

item.title: TMA (10-31-24) Hour 3
item.description:

Reminiscing on the famous road trip that brought the 2019 Stanley Cup winning Blues team together. Getting a better feeling in the room by getting the boys together. Knowing right away that the ankle was injured. Martin not taking any of the blame for the injury even though he jinxed him. How well does he know Daddy Padre? His golf handicap.
  • We're boring and talk no sports, Tim is arrogant and never gets to the point. You can criticize, just be factually correct. Martin's gonna have periodic surprises. Martin and Jackson exchange DMs. Tim and Doug are feeling a little left out. Gonna set up an alliance with Chairman Kurt. The Fescoe Year. Looking back on the years at the picnic table.
  • Martin's first surprise is none other than Keith "Walter" Tkachuck.
  • Sketches and bits. Joe Buck. Bag 'o' Bits. Martin's heading down to City Park.

item.description:

Complaints from prep sports parents. PigPen is on the phone lines with a question for the dais. Did ProdJoe fund a trip on a private jet to a gentlemen's club in Atlanta? Was PigPen a smoker? Wayne Huizenga.
  • The Note having trouble getting the puck on net and drop one to the Flyers. Audio of Drew Bannister talking about missed opportunities. Right where they wanna be in sixth place in the division. Retooling and resetting. Cheeto dust. Hate piling up on Jordan Kyrou. Cards passing on Lynn, Gibson, and Middleton.
  • We need to bring the TMA and 101 listeners together at TMA Trivia Night. Ozempic pukes. We've left general banter and entered light vamping. Not surprised by not resigning Lynn and GIbson. Martin's got deferred money in his contract. Will Arenado be back next year?

  • Friend of the show, Joey Vitale checking in this morning. Blues struggle as of late. Atmosphere at Enterprise Center tomorrow. Over/Under on the ovation for Chief. Going All South County. African elephants and the zygote community.

Hard to be single in your 30s or 40s in St. Louis. Jackson's got some air in his esophagus. Mr. Lix makes his HD1 debut. Lix stands with Janet. Problems with burgers. Lix vs. Martin. The Papal Conclave meets today to name the Listener of the Month.

If playing time is important, Mizzou may be the place to be. Mizzou uniforms. The anthracite period. Drew Pyne just hasn't been good. Tim had all the tools football coaches look for.
  • It's time to make people some money with Pick 6. Jackson's leaning into the stink. Multi-day parlays. Big game in State College, PA.

  • Gabe DeArmond of Power Mizzou joins us. Gabe's thoughts on Zollers visiting Penn State. Gabe's temperature of Mizzou fans going through the disappointment of this missed opportunity. 9 or 10 win seasons shouldn't be considered a failure at Missouri. Outlook for the final four games of the season. Brady Cook's return.

item.description:

Dan Lanning is taking food off of Tim's family's plate. TMA Trivia Night coming up. Is there more Chiefs or Cardinals gear around town? Naming the STL WNBA franchise. Rhythm & Blues.

Mizzou more than likely won't have the resume to make the playoff. Will conference divisions make a comeback? Matt Zollers and next year's QB situation. Cousin Shane.

item.title: TMA (11-5-24) Hour 1 - A Fistful of Pardons

item.title: TMA (11-5-24) Hour 2 - I Miss When I Was Happy
item.description:

item.description:

Talking Ankiel through his meltdown. Will's not a fan of the torpedo bats. Loving his time in STL.

item.title: TMA (4-16-25) Hour 2 - Come On Bro
item.description:
• Jamie’s not happy with Anaheim for giving up that late goal to the Wild. Jamie knew the boys were gonna win last night. All the lines were rolling last night. All the pressure on Winnipeg in this series. Lots of similarities to 2019. Brayden Schenn embodying everything it means to be a captain and a Blue. The logistics of the series with concert conflicts.  
  • Victor Scott AKA Argo joins the program. Getting his thoughts on the Youngry Birds track. The energy of this 2025 Cardinal team. His alter ego “Argo.” Who is the clubhouse DJ? His approach at the plate as a speedy guy with some pop. A sense of positivity in the clubhouse. Having his own music as his walk-up song. His musical inspirations.  
  • A program just full of friends of the feather. Argo (the movie) was an unremarkable best picture winner. JJ Watt got to play Augusta. Shot a 103. Rory not talking to Bryson during the final round was part of the psychological plan for Rory. Jackson thinks Bryson’s interactions with fans is a little forced. The pilot for TRHOFTMA will be at the Self Made Stay At Home Ladue Mom’s estate.

item.title: TMA (5-8-25) Hour 3 - Andy Strickland & Steven Matz
item.description:
Andy tells some stories, talks about the Blues devastating loss in Game 7. The Blues struggles with the 6v5. Andy compares and contrasts Sunday’s loss to losses from years ago. Andy also talks about the offseason possibilities and “hockey trades.”  

 Andy kind enough to stick around for another segment as we wait for Steven Matz to give us a call. Andy also breaks news of Joel Quenneville being named coach of the Ducks. The audience peppers Andy with some questions. Steven Matz joins the show talking about the 5-game win streak for the Cardinals and what he has noticed as a difference recently. Steven also discusses the home/road splits. Steven also tells us about catching a bull shark a few years ago.  

 Martin out for onboarding. Victor Scott postgame sound following his big game on the basepaths. Cardinal road trip. Fractional jet ownership.

item.description:

 The text line is still going crazy. Jackson’s Cardinals Corner. Any Cardinal teams similar to this year’s Blues season? The boys break it down. I hear whistles.

item.title: TMA (5-9-25) Hour 2 - Joey Vitale & Matt Holliday
item.description:
Joey Vitale joins the program to discuss a potpourri of topics, including but not limited to chickens, Crocs, and kissing. Joey also reflects on the 2024-25 season for the Blues and what direction he thinks the franchise will take. Spittin’ Chickens.  

Drops of the Week.  

Surprise, Surprise! Matt Holliday joins the show to talk it over. Matt talks about following the Blues playoff run and comparing the heartbreak of game 7 to some of his experiences in his career and putting himself in the shoes of the Rangers in 2011. Matt also gives his take on the current Cardinals.

item.title: TMA (7-2-25) Hour 1 - Cottages and Cardinals
item.description:
(00:00-18:45) Chemistry Night for Tim and Jackson. Adjoining rooms. What makes a house a cottage? Seven weeks of vacation is pretty standard. Dormant offense for the Redbirds in Pittsburgh. Jackson's a Pozo guy through and through. Sophie Cunningham's takes on WNBA expansion ruffling some feathers. Detroit or Miami in the summer? Big nuance guy.


(18:53-37:01) We're gonna pivot off the WNBA. Consecutive shutouts against the Pirates. Audio of Oli Marmol on the frustrating loss, the 8th inning PIrates' run, and the Fermin play. Sgt. Major Rose on the phone lines. Quality start from Pallante.


(37:11-1:05:01) Conway Twitty. Tim has a dossier question. Cardinal want wingy. Tim and Kayden Kross working on a podcast. Clip isn't necessarily for 101. Watch this Doug, A Whole New World. Jackson will heart whatever he wants to heart. Audio of Doug Armstrong talking about new acquisition Logan Mailloux. Good old-fashioned hockey trade. Audio from The Fast Lane talking to Mailloux giving his thoughts on becoming a Blue. Spelling is hard, man. Shut up Ravioli Head.

item.title: TMA (7-2-25) Hour 2 - Cardinal Want Wingy
item.description:
(00:00-12:23) Martin really starting to appreciate Akoostic Sessions. Cardinal Want Wingy. Comparing this season's trade deadline situation to years past. Run this drill, I'm gonna go get a soda or something.


(12:32-43:42) Joey Vitale joins the show. Joey doesn't like the word "fine." Back from the volleyball tournament in Dallas. Kid talk. Sid The Kid mention. Inducing childbirth. Blues offseason moves. Joey's thoughts on the Bolduc trade. Expecting more moves or are the Blues comfortable with the roster? The difficulty of position changes.


(43:52-1:03:00) Cardinals lineup. Hampson gets the day off. High run total today. Maybe a little too inviting. Happy Birthday, Oli. Cardinals 3-0 on his birthday. Are these fake game notes? Column on a player every team should trade for. Merrill Kelly. Doug hates the article. Wilson Contreras's comments on all the HBPs he's taken. Doug's never been to Guatemala.

item.title: TMA (7-2-25) Hour 3 - It's Very Hard For Me To Talk
item.description:
(00:00-16:40) American Pie. Time for the Free Space portion of the dossier. Question on legacy players and sports franchises. Cardinal legacy players. Mark McGwire in 2001. Kyle Lohse and ProdJoe were close. Ozzie Smith. Albert Pujols in his final year. Blues letting Petro go. The Ozzie/LaRussa relationship.


(16:49-29:53) Cinema Corner. Top 5 Brad Pitt movies of all time. Jackson has an important distinction to make. It's a stain on their filmography. Brio in film form. Jackson's not cut out for acting.


(30:03-39:22) Doug will shadow ban you if you pout. Chairman got his Masters Degree to be an Athletic Director. Big Tuft issues a statement. Bucket hats. Bubbles the Chimpanzee.
